title: Leave Room For DESSERT!
body_text:
This post-war, "reunion era" of East Coast Dodgeball is supposed to be for the nostalgia and memories of what once was. The weapons rest in the museum and the warriors heal their numerous wounds as they await an occasional gathering for a single night of light competition and youthful fun. This DIBUCCIO v. KERR encounter? Yes, a behind-the-scenes favorite eons ago, but never written or printed in ink then ..
so why now
? Simple! The dinner may be over but the dessert tray is full - dig in!
BACKGROUND
Those privileged to experience events 1 to 200 enjoyed the heartiest of ECD meals. As documentation proves, the not-so-friendly gentlemen waged hellacious wars - Fitzpatrick vs. C. Adams, Cornero vs. Letsche, Tronolone vs. K. Adams - on the grandest stages countless different occasions. Although significantly outnumbered, the fierce females of the ECD world have indeed battled as well: Bertsch-DeCuir, Stopa against Lima, and seven remarkable Winston-only conflicts. The colorful history essentially went unfinished, until now.
DIANA DIBUCCIO is unquestionably the most recognized female star ever and arguably of all-time. Her giant personality, mental and physical on-court capabilities, and everlasting devotion and longevity kept ECD breathing beyond any measure and paved the path for all incoming talent, ladies especially. One in particular formed an immediate bond with the larger-than-life ECDElite Hall of Famer en route to establishing her own legacy.
When MELISSA KERR first set foot at ECD 40, little did anyone of us realize she would become the greatest, most dominant female force in ECD history. But that's exactly what happened! A rocket arm, athletic agility, catching ability, and fearless attitude earned her the monicker "Killer Kerr", a fitting name that remains today. In 2013, she too, joined the prestigious ECDElite.
With their colossal encounter looming, the Megill-Edwards, Wolf-Londono, and the aforementioned gentlemen's clashes have undoubtedly met their female counterpart. DIBUCCIO v. KERR, best friends-turned-adversaries - an ECD dessert or after-dinner drink if you will - is on 11 22. Did I mention it's a CREAMation Match?
body_html:
This post-war, "reunion era" of East Coast Dodgeball is supposed to be for the nostalgia and memories of what once was. The weapons rest in the museum and the warriors heal their numerous wounds as they await an occasional gathering for a single night of light competition and youthful fun. This DIBUCCIO v. KERR encounter? Yes, a behind-the-scenes favorite eons ago, but never written or printed in ink then .. so why now? Simple! The dinner may be over but the dessert tray is full - dig in!

BACKGROUND
Those privileged to experience events 1 to 200 enjoyed the heartiest of ECD meals. As documentation proves, the not-so-friendly gentlemen waged hellacious wars - Fitzpatrick vs. C. Adams, Cornero vs. Letsche, Tronolone vs. K. Adams - on the grandest stages countless different occasions. Although significantly outnumbered, the fierce females of the ECD world have indeed battled as well: Bertsch-DeCuir, Stopa against Lima, and seven remarkable Winston-only conflicts. The colorful history essentially went unfinished, until now.



DIANA DIBUCCIO is unquestionably the most recognized female star ever and arguably of all-time. Her giant personality, mental and physical on-court capabilities, and everlasting devotion and longevity kept ECD breathing beyond any measure and paved the path for all incoming talent, ladies especially. One in particular formed an immediate bond with the larger-than-life ECDElite Hall of Famer en route to establishing her own legacy.

When MELISSA KERR first set foot at ECD 40, little did anyone of us realize she would become the greatest, most dominant female force in ECD history. But that's exactly what happened! A rocket arm, athletic agility, catching ability, and fearless attitude earned her the monicker "Killer Kerr", a fitting name that remains today. In 2013, she too, joined the prestigious ECDElite.

With their colossal encounter looming, the Megill-Edwards, Wolf-Londono, and the aforementioned gentlemen's clashes have undoubtedly met their female counterpart. DIBUCCIO v. KERR, best friends-turned-adversaries - an ECD dessert or after-dinner drink if you will - is on 11 22. Did I mention it's a CREAMation Match?
